titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: L'Église romaine a trop oublié, si jamais elle a compris, que la morale n'est pas essentiellement dans les préceptes mais dans l'espirit d'amour et de dévouement par lequel est rendu possible l'accomplissement de tout devoir. Elle parait ignorer que l'action morale est de soi la chose du monde la plus spontanée et, à dire le vrai, la principale manifestation de la liberté humaine.

I sent off the MS. of my article for "The Bishoprick". Both the "Church of England" newspaper & the "Church Times" have short notices of the first number. The weather was deplorable all day. In the afternoon I walked round the Park, & got very wet. I started to read Loisy's latest publication, "L'&EACUTE;glise et la France", which is a vigorous piece of polemical writing. The "Guardian" has on its front page a very unfair description of Barnes's proceedings at Birmingham. This probably indicates Temple's attitude.
